question: Format answer for: Regarding patient 'AII-11' from family 'Family A': What is the protein-level effect of the mutation?
context:
Based on the information contained within the provided document:

For patient 'AII-11' from 'Family A', the mutation is identified as the p.D620N mutation in the VPS35 gene (Figure 1, Table 1, page 3).

The protein-level effect of this mutation is a **missense mutation**, specifically the **p.D620N substitution**. This means that at amino acid position 620 of the VPS35 protein, an Aspartic acid (D) is replaced by an Asparagine (N).

This is stated in the abstract: "The p.D620N mutation was detected..." and "...p.D620N substitution may be a mutational hot spot...".
And in the Results section (page 2): "We detected the heterozygous missense p.D620N mutation...".
Figure 1 (page 3) shows Family A having the "VPS35 p.D620N mutation".
Table 1 (page 3) lists patient AII-11 under "VPS35 p.D620N" as "A", indicating the presence of the G>A nucleotide change that results in the D620N amino acid change.
